rows.SEMESTER FRAMEWORK: 12-week semesters. Each one has enrollment, curriculum, midterms, finals, grades.

rows.col_3: Review last semester grades, set this semester goals, assign TUPs to programs, confirm resources
rows.col_4: Semester Plan: goals, TUPs, owners, milestones per program

rows.col_3: Execute foundational TUPs, set up campaigns/systems for the semester, baseline metrics
rows.col_4: All TUPs kicked off, baselines documented, systems live
rows.col_5: First two weeks of class — laying groundwork

rows.col_3: Primary work phase. Run campaigns, test, iterate, produce.
rows.col_4: Weekly metrics updates, first results from new initiatives

rows.col_3: Midterm review. Are we on track? What's working, what's not? Adjust.
rows.col_4: Midterm Report: progress vs goals, course corrections, kill decisions

rows.col_3: Doubled down on winners, killed losers, push toward semester goals
rows.col_4: Continued execution with midterm adjustments applied

rows.col_3: Close out TUPs, document results, prep for next semester
rows.col_4: TUP completion reports, metrics locked, lessons documented

rows.col_3: Semester review. Grade every program. Grade every person. Plan next semester.
rows.col_4: Semester Report Card, Program Grades, Individual Grades, Next Semester Draft Plan
Table Set → First Blood. Build the machine. Focus: Acquisition + Conversion.
First Blood → Winner Found. Optimize the machine. Focus: Conversion + Retention.
Winner Found → Scale. Scale the machine. Focus: Acquisition + Product.
Scale → Sustainability. Harden the machine. Focus: Retention + Operations + Finance.
